intro: Heliotropium biblianum, commonly known as the sand heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It is a herbaceous annual plant that typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, characterized by its branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The flowers are usually pale purple or pink, with a distinctive central disc, and bloom during the warm season. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and dry fields.
